net.sf.mmm.content.parser.base

Class AbstractContentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.content.parser.base.AbstractContentParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContentParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractContentParserGeneric, AbstractContentParserOoxml, AbstractContentParserOpenDoc, AbstractContentParserPoi, AbstractContentParserText, ContentParserPdf, ContentParserXml

    public abstract class AbstractContentParser
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements ContentParser
    This is the abstract base implementation of a ContentParser. It handles the delegation methods, the creation of the MutableGenericContext and the safe closing of the InputStream.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • doInitialize

        protected void doInitialize()
        This method performs the actual initialization. It is called when AbstractComponent.initialize() is invoked for the first time.
        ATTENTION:
        When you override this method from a sub-class you need to do a super.AbstractComponent.doInitialize().
        Overrides:
        doInitialize in class AbstractLoggableComponent

      • getPrimaryKeys

        public final Set<String> getPrimaryKeys()
        This method gets the primary keys used to register this ContentParser. This set contains extension and mimetype and maybe other alternatives.
        Examples:
        • An HTML-parser will return "html" for ContentParser.getExtension() but can also include "htm" as primary key.
        • A text-parser with extension "tar.gz" may also include "tgz" as primary key.
        • An XML-parser with mimetype "text/xml" may also include "application/xml" as primary key.
        Specified by:
        getPrimaryKeys in interface ContentParser
        Returns:
        the alias keys (extensions and mimetypes) of this ContentParser.
        See Also:
        ContentParserService.getParser(String), ContentParser.getSecondaryKeys(), Collections.emptySet()

      • getAlternativeKeyArray

        public String[] getAlternativeKeyArray()
        This method gets the alternative primary keys in addition to extension and mimetype.
        Returns:
        an array with the alternative keys.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryKeys()

      • getSecondaryKeyArray

        public String[] getSecondaryKeyArray()
        This method gets the secondary keys as array. This is just a convenience to make it easier for the implementors of individual parsers not to deal with creating a Set and make it unmodifiable.
        Returns:
        an array with the alternative keys.
        See Also:
        getPrimaryKeys()

      • getSecondaryKeys

        public final Set<String> getSecondaryKeys()
        This method gets the secondary keys used to register this ContentParser. If an other (more specific) ContentParser defines such key as primary key, that ContentParser is chosen first. Otherwise this implementation will be used.
        Examples:
        • An HTML-parser will return "html" for ContentParser.getExtension() but can define "xhtml" and "application/xhtml+xml" as secondary key.
        • A text-parser with extension "txt" may return "java", "php", "c", "cpp", etc. as secondary keys.
        Specified by:
        getSecondaryKeys in interface ContentParser
        Returns:
        the alias keys (extensions and mimetypes) of this ContentParser.
        See Also:
        ContentParserService.getParser(String), ContentParser.getPrimaryKeys(), Collections.emptySet()

      • parse

        public final GenericContext parse(InputStream inputStream,
                                  long filesize)
                           throws Exception
        This method parses the document given as inputStream and extracts text and metadata returned as GenericContext.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface ContentParser
        Parameters:
        inputStream - is the fresh input stream of the content to parse. It will be closed by this method (on success and in exceptional state).
        filesize - is the size (content-length) of the content to parse in bytes or 0 if NOT available (unknown). If available, the parser may use this value for optimized allocations.
        Returns:
        the GenericContext containing the extracted metadata from the parsed inputStream. See the VARIABLE_NAME_* constants (e.g. ContentParser.VARIABLE_NAME_TEXT) for the default keys. Please note that an implementation may use individual names for additional variables.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the parsing failed for a technical reason. There can be arbitrary implementations for this interface that can throw any Exception from this method. Declaring a specific ParseException here would cause the overhead of additional encapsulation of exceptions without any advantage. The user of this interface has to catch for Exception what includes RuntimeExceptions and excludes Errors. He has to handle the problem anyways (also for RuntimeExceptions) and has all contextual information required to enhance the exception message. This is NOT a matter of bad design.

      • parse

        public GenericContext parse(InputStream inputStream,
                            long filesize,
                            ContentParserOptions options)
                     throws Exception
        This method parses the document given as inputStream and extracts text and metadata returned as GenericContext.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface ContentParser
        Parameters:
        inputStream - is the fresh input stream of the content to parse. It will be closed by this method (on success and in exceptional state).
        filesize - is the size (content-length) of the content to parse in bytes or 0 if NOT available (unknown). If available, the parser may use this value for optimized allocations.
        options - are the ContentParserOptions.
        Returns:
        the GenericContext containing the extracted metadata from the parsed inputStream. See the VARIABLE_NAME_* constants (e.g. ContentParser.VARIABLE_NAME_TEXT) for the default keys. Please note that an implementation may use individual names for additional variables.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the parsing failed for a technical reason. There can be arbitrary implementations for this interface that can throw any Exception from this method. Declaring a specific ParseException here would cause the overhead of additional encapsulation of exceptions without any advantage. The user of this interface has to catch for Exception what includes RuntimeExceptions and excludes Errors. He has to handle the problem anyways (also for RuntimeExceptions) and has all contextual information required to enhance the exception message. This is NOT a matter of bad design.

      • parse

        protected abstract void parse(InputStream inputStream,
                              long filesize,
                              ContentParserOptions options,
                              MutableGenericContext context)
                       throws Exception
        Parameters:
        inputStream - is the fresh input stream of the content to parse.
        filesize - is the size (content-length) of the content to parse in bytes or 0 if NOT available (unknown). If available, the parser may use this value for optimized allocations.
        options - are the ContentParserOptions.
        context - is the MutableGenericContext where the extracted metadata from the parsed inputStream will be added to.
        Throws:
        Exception - if the operation fails for arbitrary reasons.
        See Also:
        ContentParser.parse(InputStream, long)
